channel.title: Showing Off My Oldschool Sig Maker. :)
channel.description:
Decided I would show this off. Since I've been getting better with PHP I decided I would learn how to dynamically generate images with PHP.
Working Demo: [url=http://07tools.com]Oldschool Sig Generator[/url]
It's still a bit nooby. :P [img]http://07tools.com/sig.php?username=bcrypt&style=green[/img]
Features:
- Sig themes
Note: I won't post source code for this because I don't want my code stolen. If you can write a script like this that is good for you. :)
Credits:
Anthony for helping me debug it. :D

item.title: Showing Off My Oldschool Sig Maker. :)
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Without the source there is literally 0 point in posting it, you should be making everything you write open source unless its never been done before (or at least that’s the way I see it) because regardless of what you wrote, there will be something bigger and better, there always is! With open source you can get feedback from developers who are more experienced than you and ultimately optimise your code into being good.

Read full topic
item.source: Showing Off My Oldschool Sig Maker. :)
